intro: Athroandra welwitschiana, commonly known as the Welwitschia, is a unique plant native to the Namib Desert in Namibia. It is a gymnosperm, belonging to the family Gnetales, and is notable for its longevity and ability to survive in arid conditions. The plant has a thick, woody trunk and large, leathery leaves that can persist for decades. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers and is adapted to extreme environmental conditions through its deep root system and specialized water storage structures. Athroandra welwitschiana is considered a living fossil, with a lineage dating back to the Mesozoic era.
